snippet: The discovery explains a crucial juncture in the evolution of East Asians, and the method used can also be applied to some 400 other sites on the human genome.
abstract: Researchers publish in journal Cell that they have identified 35,000-year-old mutation in critical human gene as source of several distinctive traits that make East Asians different from other races; method used can also be applied to some 400 other sites on the human genome, providing deeper insight into human evolution.
lead_paragraph: The discovery explains a crucial juncture in the evolution of East Asians, and the method used can also be applied to some 400 other sites on the human genome.

headline.seo: Studying Recent Human Evolution at the Genetic Level
headline.main: East Asian Physical Traits Linked to 35,000-Year-Old Mutation
headline.print_headline: East Asian Physical Traits Linked to 35,000-Year-Old Mutation
